ARTICLE.TITLE: Police concerned for man missing from Sydney’s south
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Police are appealing for public assistance to locate a man missing from Sydney’s south.

Lawrence Kotov, aged 32, was last seen yesterday (Friday 14 August 2020) after he left a relatives’ house at Sylvania.

Officers from South Sydney Police Area Command were alerted when he failed to turn up at a family members’ home at Matraville.

Concerns are held for his welfare and police are appealing for assistance from the community to locate him.

Lawrence is described as being of Middle Eastern appearance, approximately 180cm to 185cm tall, with a medium build and black hair.

He was last seen wearing a blue jumper and dark track suit pants.

Police believe Lawrence is driving a white Mitsubishi ASX station wagon, with NSW registration

CT 72 YZ.

Anyone who sees Lawrence, or believes they know his whereabouts, is urged to contact police immediately.

Anyone with information about this incident is urged to contact Crime Stoppers: 1800 333 000 or https://nsw.crimestoppers.com.au. Information is treated in strict confidence.
